text:
(Note: I spent a long time figuring out how best to phrase this… then I decided to turn off my filter because on this channel (and I believe, in general) we are too afraid of stepping on toes to say what we mean).

As somebody who is obviously white, I have found it incredibly difficult to figure out how best to deal with the shooting of black citizens by police officers (both recently and earlier this summer and even well before that). Do I voice my support or is it counter-productive because I have no right to talk about something that doesn’t affect me? Do I march in the Black Lives Matter protests going on around my campus (note: I did). How do I help without imposing myself on a culture that I’m not a part of? I found the following website (as well as Just Mercy (note: this is like my 18th shameless plug for that book)) very helpful in educating myself. I hope that some of the rest of you might as well. Disclaimer: I have not read all of the articles linked here. However, I have found the ones that I have incredibly informative and helpful in bringing awareness to my own blind spots.
